issues.description: The templateâ€™s Farm.java defines singFarmSongVerse without an Animal parameter, but the UML and solution both require singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal). Without the parameter, students cannot implement the per-animal verses as specified.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template Farm.java, change the signature to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) so it matches the UML and the solution implementation.

issues.description: The commented example in Main.java uses two-argument constructors (e.g. Seal(String name, String type)), but the problem statement and solution define Animal subclasses with single-argument constructors taking only the name. This mismatch will confuse students about which constructor to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the commented example in Main.java to use single-parameter constructors (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle");) to align with the UML and solution.
